cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterflies transfer pollen as they move between flowers.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject moves or carries the object substance or entity from one location to another.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Pollen is moved between flowers during pollination.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject material is transported or moved between instances of the object category.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject actively moves or carries the object (a material or entity) from one location or entity to another.
args.justification: This relation describes butterflies actively moving pollen between flowers, which is a material transfer interaction. The existing canonical_rel_name already fits but the description is refined for clarity. rel_cls_group remains INTERACTION to emphasize the agent–material interaction rather than merely spatial positioning.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject material is transported or moved between instances of the object entity category, typically by some agent.
args.justification: This relation describes pollen being transported between flowers, which is the same underlying material transfer interaction as in RelR_be3c581402bb but expressed in passive form (material-centric). Unifying rel_cls to 'material_transfer_relation' improves schema coherence, and rel_cls_group is set to INTERACTION because the core meaning is a transfer process, not just spatial arrangement.

The existing canonical_rel_name already fits but the description is refined for clarity. rel_cls_group remains INTERACTION to emphasize the agent–material interaction rather than merely spatial positioning.

executed_decisions.justification: This relation describes pollen being transported between flowers, which is the same underlying material transfer interaction as in RelR_be3c581402bb but expressed in passive form (material-centric). Unifying rel_cls to 'material_transfer_relation' improves schema coherence, and rel_cls_group is set to INTERACTION because the core meaning is a transfer process, not just spatial arrangement.
